application.resources.levels

Class Level1BController

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.resources.sandboxController
      • application.resources.levels.Level1BController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class Level1BController
extends sandboxController
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    It extends the `sandboxController` class and implements the `Initializable` interface. The `Level1BController` class is responsible for managing the user interface and logic of Level 1B. It handles the generation of gate objects, pre-loading of objects, and checking if the game is won. The class contains various instance variables, including the circuit board pane, buttons, image views, labels, and pre-loaded object panes. It also defines an enum `Type` to represent different types of objects. The class provides methods for initializing the level, loading pre-loaded objects, generating gate objects, and checking if the game is won. It also includes getter and setter methods for accessing the circuit board pane. The `Level1BController` class follows the JavaFX controller pattern and is designed to work with the LogicLand application. It interacts with the user interface and handles user input to create and manipulate gate objects on the circuit board. Credit where credit is due, some of the code for generating draggable nodes, as well as linking them with a line (makeWire()), was inspired by / borrowed from Joell Graff's tutorial "Drag-and-Drop in JavaFX" found here https://monograff76.wordpress.com/2015/02/20/.
    Since:
    1.0

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL arg0,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle arg1)
        Initializes the controller after its root element has been completely processed. This method sets up the initial state of the sandbox controller, pre-loading gate objects into placeholders, creating connections between them, and starting a video demo.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Overrides:
        initialize in class sandboxController
        Parameters:
        arg0 - URL for the root object initialization, not used in this method
        arg1 - ResourceBundle, not used in this method

      • CheckToWin

        public void CheckToWin()
        Checks if the current state of the outputs indicates a win condition for the level. If the outputs match the expected values, updates the level score in the AccountManager and displays a congratulatory message using an Alert dialog. If the outputs do not match, displays a message indicating to try again.

      • callChecktype

        public void callChecktype(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle node)
        Calls the checktype method of the appropriate gateController based on the ClassType of the given node. This method is used to update the gate's state based on its inputs.
        Overrides:
        callChecktype in class sandboxController
        Parameters:
        node - The Rectangle node representing a gate's terminal.

      • getCircuitBoardPane

        public javafx.scene.layout.Pane getCircuitBoardPane()
        Gets the circuit board pane.
        Overrides:
        getCircuitBoardPane in class sandboxController
        Returns:
        The circuit board pane, which represents the area where gate objects are placed and wired.

      • load

        public javafx.scene.layout.Pane load(javafx.scene.layout.Pane origin,
                                     Level1BController.Type type)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a pre-defined gate object onto the circuit board. This method is used to pre-load objects into the level (not object generator). The pre-defined gate objects are created based on the specified type. The gate object loaded by this method is set to be immovable.
        Parameters:
        origin - The origin pane where the gate object will be loaded from.
        type - The type of gate (e.g., Type.AND, Type.OR, Type.NOT, etc.).
        Returns:
        The loaded gate object as a Pane.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.

      • generator

        public void generator(java.lang.String fxml,
                      Level1BController.Type type,
                      javafx.scene.image.ImageView origin)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Generates a gate object on the circuit board based on the provided parameters. Each gate object is represented as a node in the user interface. Nodes are used to pass information from user interface events to the sandboxController.
        Parameters:
        fxml - The path to the FXML file that defines the gate object.
        type - The type of gate (e.g., Type.AND, Type.OR, Type.NOT, etc.).
        origin - The ImageView representing the origin of the gate generation (e.g., button image).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.

      • andGenerator

        public void andGenerator()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Generates an AND gate on the circuit board when called. This method is responsible for creating an AND gate by calling the general generator method with specific parameters for the AND gate. If an exception occurs during the generation process, it is caught and printed.
        Overrides:

      • beginConnection

        public void beginConnection(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Initiates the process of creating a wire connection when a mouse click and drag occurs on a terminal of a gate. Draws a temporary line on the screen from the terminal to the mouse cursor while the mouse is dragged. Records the starting node of the drag and the ending node of the drag. All terminal buttons are represented as invisible rectangles that trigger events when clicked. If both the start and stop of the drag are terminals, and the terminals are of different types, then the two nodes are passed to the function makeWire to create a wire connection.
        Overrides:
        beginConnection in class sandboxController
        Parameters:
        event - The MouseEvent triggered when the user clicks on a terminal.

      • makeWire

        public void makeWire(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle outputTerminal,
                     javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle inputTerminal)
        Creates a visual wire connecting two terminals on the circuit board. The wire is drawn as a Line between the output and input terminals. Adjusts the Line's position based on the terminals' positions within their parent panes. Handles the logic for replacing old wires when new ones are created.
        Overrides:
        makeWire in class sandboxController
        Parameters:
        outputTerminal - The Rectangle representing the output terminal.
        inputTerminal - The Rectangle representing the input terminal.

      • deleteButton

        public void deleteButton(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Toggles the delete state and cursor style for deleting components on the circuit board. Plays a sound effect and changes the delete button's appearance based on the state.
        Overrides:
        deleteButton in class sandboxController
        Parameters:
        event - The MouseEvent triggered by clicking the delete button.

      • delete

        public void delete(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Handles the deletion of components in the LogicLand circuit board. Plays a sound effect and deletes either a wire connection or a gate based on the user's interaction.
        Overrides:
        delete in class sandboxController
        Parameters:
        event - The MouseEvent triggered by the user's interaction with the circuit board.

      • roadMap

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurs while switching scenes.

      • backPart

        public void backPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Handles the action event for going back to Part A of Level 1. This method plays a "boop" sound, then switches the scene to Level 1A.
        Parameters:
        event - The ActionEvent that triggers this method.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O exception occurs while switching scenes.
